title: How to Make Rainbow Popsicles

steps.headline: Make the red layer.
steps.description: Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen strawberries, frozen raspberries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a red color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Make the orange layer.
steps.description: Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen peaches, orange, frozen mango, and milk until well-combined, resembling an orange color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Make the yellow layer.
steps.description: Blend the bananas, yogurt, frozen pineapple, and milk until well-combined, resembling a yellow color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Make the green layer.
steps.description: Blend the bananas, yogurt, spinach, frozen pineapple, and milk until well-combined, resembling a green color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Make the blue layer.
steps.description: Blend the bananas, yogurt, frozen pineapple, frozen blueberries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a blue color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Make the purple layer.
steps.description: Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen berries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a purple color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Make the magenta layer.
steps.description: Blend the banana, yogurt, canned beets, and frozen berries until well-combined, resembling a magenta color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Layer a few tablespoons of each colored smoothie into a popsicle mold until it reaches the top.
Repeat until each mold has been filled in.
Cover the popsicle mold with foil.
Poke popsicle sticks into each mold.
Freeze the rainbow popsicles for four hours till overnight until hard.
Gently wash the molds with warm water.
Serve.
steps.description: Carefully remove each rainbow popsicle from its mold. Enjoy!

text: Making the Popsicle Layers Make the red layer. Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen strawberries, frozen raspberries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a red color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Make the orange layer. Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen peaches, orange, frozen mango, and milk until well-combined, resembling an orange color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Make the yellow layer. Blend the bananas, yogurt, frozen pineapple, and milk until well-combined, resembling a yellow color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Make the green layer. Blend the bananas, yogurt, spinach, frozen pineapple, and milk until well-combined, resembling a green color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Make the blue layer. Blend the bananas, yogurt, frozen pineapple, frozen blueberries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a blue color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Make the purple layer. Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen berries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a purple color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Make the magenta layer. Blend the banana, yogurt, canned beets, and frozen berries until well-combined, resembling a magenta color. Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use. Making the Popsicles Layer a few tablespoons of each colored smoothie into a popsicle mold until it reaches the top.  Repeat until each mold has been filled in.  Cover the popsicle mold with foil.  Poke popsicle sticks into each mold.  Freeze the rainbow popsicles for four hours till overnight until hard.  Gently wash the molds with warm water.  Serve. Carefully remove each rainbow popsicle from its mold. Enjoy!
sentences: Making the Popsicle Layers Make the red layer.
Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen strawberries, frozen raspberries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a red color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Make the orange layer.
Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen peaches, orange, frozen mango, and milk until well-combined, resembling an orange color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Make the yellow layer.
Blend the bananas, yogurt, frozen pineapple, and milk until well-combined, resembling a yellow color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Make the green layer.
Blend the bananas, yogurt, spinach, frozen pineapple, and milk until well-combined, resembling a green color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Make the blue layer.
Blend the bananas, yogurt, frozen pineapple, frozen blueberries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a blue color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Make the purple layer.
Blend the banana, yogurt, frozen berries, and milk until well-combined, resembling a purple color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Make the magenta layer.
Blend the banana, yogurt, canned beets, and frozen berries until well-combined, resembling a magenta color.
Pour in a medium-sized bowl and set aside for later use.
Making the Popsicles Layer a few tablespoons of each colored smoothie into a popsicle mold until it reaches the top.
Repeat until each mold has been filled in.
Cover the popsicle mold with foil.
Poke popsicle sticks into each mold.
Freeze the rainbow popsicles for four hours till overnight until hard.
Gently wash the molds with warm water.
Serve.
Carefully remove each rainbow popsicle from its mold.
Enjoy!
